intro: Deinbollia molliuscula, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its seeds are encased in a fleshy, hairy capsule that splits open when mature. Deinbollia molliuscula is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in certain regions.
